item.title: Connection Errors
item.dc:creator: @vortex vortex
item.description:
@vortex wrote:

Open class a, there you will find this

public static a n(String s, Applet applet, int i1) throws IOException { Socket socket; if(applet != null) { socket = new Socket(InetAddress.getByName(applet.getCodeBase().getHost()), i1); } else { socket = new Socket(InetAddress.getByName(s), i1); } socket.setSoTimeout(30000); return new a(socket); }

Change it to this

public static a n(String s, Applet applet, int i1) throws IOException { Socket socket = new Socket(InetAddress.getByName(s), i1); socket.setSoTimeout(30000); return new a(socket); }

The error you got was caused by applet.getCodeBase(), which doesn’t exist because there is no applet

Read full topic

item.title: Connection Errors
item.dc:creator: @dimebagx dimebagx
item.description:
@dimebagx wrote:

Mudclient61, same error in mudclient40 in the other topic (could be a all round client error in general)

The error, is nullpointerexception, when you try to connect via new user/existing user

i’ve narrowed it down,

(k.java)

[code] public final void dj(int j, int l, String s, boolean flag)
{
mp = true; // Applet/Text Based CACHE?
System.out.println(“Started application”);
fp = j;
gp = l;
lp = new d(this, j, l, s, flag, false);
rp = 1;
hp = new Thread(this);
hp.start();
hp.setPriority(1);
}

public final boolean zj()
{
    return true; // Applet/Text Based CACHE? (was return mp)
}[/code]

This is what Vortex changed to get the client running on the normal cache , instead of the text files,
Allthough the weird thing is, When it was reading the text files (mp = false) It would connect, but still had alot
of errors from missing cache.

but with the value set true (normal cache) there are no errors, instead it won’t connect, you get a nullpointerexception
it doesn’t even try to login (no login response at all)

And i’ve located where the errors are coming from:
This is for existing user: (e.java)

public void gb(String s1, String s2) { try { cd = s1; s1 = o.tn(s1, 20); dd = s2; s2 = o.tn(s2, 20); if(s1.trim().length() == 0 || s2.trim().length() == 0) { pb(uc[0], uc[1]); return; } pb(uc[6], uc[7]); if(zj()) { ed = a.n(zc, this, bd); } else { ed = a.n(zc, null, bd); } byte abyte0[] = { 127, 0, 0, 1 }; try { InetAddress inetaddress = ed.o(); abyte0 = inetaddress.getAddress(); } catch(Exception _ex) { } if(abyte0[0] == 127 && abyte0[1] == 0 && abyte0[2] == 0 && abyte0[3] == 1) { try { InetAddress inetaddress1 = InetAddress.getLocalHost(); abyte0 = inetaddress1.getAddress(); } catch(Exception _ex) { } } try { if(abyte0[0] == 127 && abyte0[1] == 0 && abyte0[2] == 0 && abyte0[3] == 1 && zj()) { String s3 = getParameter("client"); if(s3 != null && s3.equals("exe")) { abyte0[0] = (byte)(int)(Math.random() * 256D); abyte0[1] = (byte)(int)(Math.random() * 256D); abyte0[2] = (byte)(int)(Math.random() * 256D); abyte0[3] = (byte)(int)(Math.random() * 256D); } } } catch(Exception _ex) { } ed.a(0); ed.c(o.mn(s1)); ed.i(s2); ed.l(yc); ed.m(abyte0[0]); ed.m(abyte0[1]); ed.m(abyte0[2]); ed.m(abyte0[3]); ed.f(); ed.ub(); int i = ed.zb(); System.out.println("Login response: " + i); if(i == 0) { lb(); v(); return; } if(i == 2) { pb(uc[8], uc[9]); return; } if(i == 3) { pb(uc[10], uc[11]); return; } if(i == 4) { pb(uc[4], uc[5]); return; } if(i == 5) { pb(uc[16], uc[17]); return; } if(i == 6) { pb(uc[18], uc[19]); return; } if(i == 7) { pb(uc[20], uc[21]); return; } else { pb(uc[12], uc[13]); return; } } catch(Exception exception) { zc = ad; System.out.println("Error 1"); System.out.println(String.valueOf(exception)); pb(uc[12], uc[13]); return; } }

This is for new user: (e.java)

public void eb(String s1, String s2, String s3, int i, int j, int l) { try { if(zj()) { ed = a.n(zc, this, bd); } else { ed = a.n(zc, null, bd); } ed.a(2); s1 = o.tn(s1, 20); s2 = o.tn(s2, 20); ed.c(o.mn(s1)); ed.i(s2); for(; s3.length() < 40; s3 = s3 + " ") { } ed.i(s3); ed.k(i); ed.k(j); ed.k(l); ed.d(); ed.ub(); int i1 = ed.zb(); ed.yb(); System.out.println("Newplayer response: " + i1); if(i1 == 0) { ib(); return; } if(i1 == 2) { pb(uc[8], uc[9]); return; } if(i1 == 3) { pb(uc[14], uc[15]); return; } if(i1 == 4) { pb(uc[4], uc[5]); return; } if(i1 == 5) { pb(uc[16], uc[17]); return; } if(i1 == 6) { pb(uc[18], uc[19]); return; } if(i1 == 7) { pb(uc[20], uc[21]); return; } else { pb(uc[12], uc[13]); return; } } catch(Exception exception) { zc = ad; System.out.println("Error 2"); System.out.println(String.valueOf(exception)); pb(uc[12], uc[13]); return; } }
